node.display_long_description:
A cooperative and chaotic party game that requires you to shout technobabble at your friends! Play with people on mobile/tablet and with other VR players online. You can also shout at yourself in practice mode. 

Attempt to follow randomly generated, incorrectly assigned instructions.

If your Spaceteam can complete enough instructions successfully in a sector you will progress to the next, each sector becomes increasingly difficult and as the ship becomes harder to control!

FULL VR MULTIPLAYER
Up to 6 players, connected to the internet, in any popular VR headset join in a coop game of trying to avoid their binding doom.

FACE TO FACE
Up to 6 players locally with at least one headset and connected smart devices, this offers an experience much like the original Spaceteam game.

SINGLE PLAYER
In Practice Mode you will join 2 of our trusty robots!

And remember to work together… as a Spaceteam!

latest_supported_binary.change_log:
General
VOIP quality improvements, fixes for some cut outs and non-working voice that could occur!
Improved Quest performance
Smoothed out the movement of our UFOs
Added player has joined notifications
Sometimes incorrect player names fixed up 
Removed the pumpkins!

Networking
Game lobbies show whether open or in progress
Fixed incorrect region selection 
Improved networking of thrown objects, fixes up debris issues 

Quest 
Fixed up colour space on Quest 1 + 2
Increased FX visual quality on Quest 2

Controls
Fixed sponge collisions with some controls
Fixes to the pump thresholds and added notifications to it, pumping should now be 42% more fun!

Symbol mode
Improved the readability of multi-glyph controls
Fixed up incidental instructions breaking symbols appearing for all the panel

Robots
You can now play as one of our three robots! (CRT-3000, Cylindrake and Priscilla)
Should now be friendlier and wave at you properly!
Gave them a few tweaks and upgraded their OS

Difficulty
Tweaked hard mode to make it a little smoother difficulty wise

nodes.title: UPDATE TIME - 3652 (15th December)
nodes.body_text:
Festive Greetings, Space Cadets!

Just before we wrap things up for Christmas, we’re excited to announce the latest update for Spaceteam VR across all supported platforms.

This update contains several tweaks and quality of life improvements, and for the first time ever, you can now play as our iconic robots! The robots are now selectable as the player avatar in the customisation options.

General

- VOIP quality improvements, fixes for some cut-outs and non-working voice that could occur!
- Improved Quest performance
- Smoothed out the movement of our UFOs
- Added “player has joined” notifications
- Incorrect player names sometimes being shown has been fixed up
- Threw away the pumpkins left over from Halloween! (they were starting to go a little funky)

Networking

- Game lobbies now show if open or in progress
- Fixed incorrect region selection
- Improved networking of thrown objects, fixes up debris issues

Quest Specific

- Fixed up colour space on Quest 1 + 2
- Increased FX visual quality on Quest 2

Controls

- Fixed sponge collisions with some controls
- Fixes to the pump thresholds and added notifications to it, pumping should
now be 42% more fun!

Symbol mode

- Improved the readability of multi-glyph controls
- Fixed up incidental instructions breaking symbols appearing for all the panel

Robots

- You can now play as one of our three robots! 
(CRT-3000, Cylindrake and Priscilla)
- Should now be friendlier and wave at you properly!
- Gave them a few tweaks and upgraded their OS

Difficulty

- Tweaked hard mode to make the difficulty increase between sectors a little smoother

We also have further updates coming in the new year offering more ways to play with your friends, new types of anomalies and reducing the wait time on multiplayer games!

nodes.title: UPDATE TIME - 3011 (13th August 2020)
nodes.body_text:
Please update your game version otherwise online functions will not work

General
•    General fixes prepping for other updates coming soon – be sure to watch our Discord and Twitter for more information! 
•    Difficulty tweaks to reduce aggression of the super nova especially on easy levels! Further balancing across other sectors
•    Ongoing improvements to panel generation and control placement

Anomalies
•    Goop and oil return!  Get those sponges ready!

node.reviewDescription:
I'll tell you what, this game is really fun and the developers are putting their heart and soul into it. You get two people or three people or four people playing it, yet it's a multiplayer game, and it's co-op, so you won't really feel like throwing the headset across the room when you lose like in PVP.  Well, you might (#$@& flying saucers!!)

I haven't played with a six-man team yet, but I can imagine the chaos that would ensue and how absolutely a blast it would be. There would literally have to be some sort of organizational thing going on. People shouting over each other trying to get the commands out, things catching on fire, switches breaking, someone's voice sounds like they did a bunch of helium and are talking really fast and you have no idea what they're saying, the other dude's head is gigantic and he's talking really slow with a Wooommp kind of tone to his voice. People trying to figure out how to pronounce the words for the commands that you're telling other people.. honestly, it's like a board game, in a way, come to life.

Also, it's a puzzle game. Let's face it, if you like puzzle games and you like challenges, and you like to play with your friends, or you like to play with other people (with puzzle games) (get your mind out of the gutter) then this is pretty much a win-win situation. I think what people need to do when they play this game is friends list everybody that you play with and start getting groups going on on a daily basis.

Stop listening to these little kids that can't wait 5 minutes for someone to show up and play with them and so they leave and then write a bad review.

It's like Anthony Bourdain when he talks about yelp. Look up the YouTube video, he says that yelpers are the worst human beings on Earth because they leave bad reviews for the wrong reasons and ruin restaurants. 

I promise you, get this game, have your friends or family get this game, you can even play it if you have a group of people in the same room, one person jumps on the VR headset and the rest of the people can play it from their phone.

Obviously it's going to be even better if you're one of those Rich families where everybody has a headset LOL.

Oh, and I'll tell you what, if you get this game, send me a friend request, I'll accept it, then send me a chat message and tell me you bought the game, and I'll find time to jump in with ya.

Do it! Do it NOW! (Get to da choppah!!)
node.reviewTitle: The Reviews are Dumb. This Game Rocks

developerResponse.body: Hey there. Thanks very much for taking the time to leave a review. We're delighted to hear how much you enjoy Spaceteam VR. We've got some exciting things planned for the near future of Spaceteam VR, too! We have some new anomalies being introduced adding even more variety to the gameplay. There's a PSVR version in the works which will have cross-play with the PCVR and Oculus community, increasing player numbers and reducing any potential wait times for a game. We also have another little surprise up our sleeves which will bring even more players into the chaos of Spaceteam VR - we'll have more to reveal on that very soon.

website_page_meta.description: A cooperative and chaotic party game that requires you to shout technobabble at your friends! You need to work together… as a Spaceteam!
website_page_meta.title: Spaceteam VR · Oculus Quest
